api.label: List
api.synopsis: Lists are ordered indexed dense collections, much like a JavaScript Array.

api.label: Map
api.synopsis: Immutable Map is an unordered Collection.Keyed of (key, value) pairs with O(log32 N) gets and O(log32 N) persistent sets.

api.label: OrderedMap
api.synopsis: A type of Map that has the additional guarantee that the iteration order of entries will be the order in which they were set().

api.label: Set
api.synopsis: A Collection of unique values with O(log32 N) adds and has.

api.label: OrderedSet
api.synopsis: A type of Set that has the additional guarantee that the iteration order of values will be the order in which they were added.

api.label: Stack
api.synopsis: Stacks are indexed collections which support very efficient O(1) addition and removal from the front using unshift(v) and shift().

api.label: Range()
api.synopsis: Returns a Seq.Indexed of numbers from start (inclusive) to end (exclusive), by step, where start defaults to 0, step to 1, and end to infinity. When start is equal to end, returns empty range.

api.label: Repeat()
api.synopsis: Returns a Seq.Indexed of value repeated times times. When times is not defined, returns an infinite Seq of value.

api.label: Record
api.synopsis: A record is similar to a JS object, but enforces a specific set of allowed string keys, and has default values.

api.label: Record.Factory
api.synopsis: A Record.Factory is created by the Record() function. Record instances are created by passing it some of the accepted values for that Record type:

api.label: Seq
api.synopsis: Seq describes a lazy operation, allowing them to efficiently chain use of all the higher-order collection methods (such as map and filter) by not creating intermediate collections.

api.label: Seq.Keyed
api.synopsis: Seq which represents key-value pairs.

api.label: Seq.Indexed
api.synopsis: Seq which represents an ordered indexed list of values.

api.label: Seq.Set
api.synopsis: Seq which represents a set of values.

api.label: Collection
api.synopsis: The Collection is a set of (key, value) entries which can be iterated, and is the base class for all collections in immutable, allowing them to make use of all the Collection methods (such as map and filter).

api.label: Collection.Keyed
api.synopsis: Keyed Collections have discrete keys tied to each value.

api.label: Collection.Indexed
api.synopsis: Indexed Collections have incrementing numeric keys. They exhibit slightly different behavior than Collection.Keyed for some methods in order to better mirror the behavior of JavaScript's Array, and add methods which do not make sense on non-indexed Collections such as indexOf.

api.label: Collection.Set
api.synopsis: Set Collections only represent values. They have no associated keys or indices. Duplicate values are possible in the lazy Seq.Sets, however the concrete Set Collection does not allow duplicate values.

api.label: fromJS()
api.synopsis: Deeply converts plain JS objects and arrays to Immutable Maps and Lists.

api.label: is()
api.synopsis: Value equality check with semantics similar to Object.is, but treats Immutable Collections as values, equal if the second Collection includes equivalent values.

api.label: hash()
api.synopsis: The hash() function is an important part of how Immutable determines if two values are equivalent and is used to determine how to store those values. Provided with any value, hash() will return a 31-bit integer.

api.label: isImmutable()
api.synopsis: True if maybeImmutable is an Immutable Collection or Record.

api.label: isCollection()
api.synopsis: True if maybeCollection is a Collection, or any of its subclasses.

api.label: isKeyed()
api.synopsis: True if maybeKeyed is a Collection.Keyed, or any of its subclasses.

api.label: isIndexed()
api.synopsis: True if maybeIndexed is a Collection.Indexed, or any of its subclasses.

api.label: isAssociative()
api.synopsis: True if maybeAssociative is either a Keyed or Indexed Collection.

api.label: isOrdered()
api.synopsis: True if maybeOrdered is a Collection where iteration order is well defined. True for Collection.Indexed as well as OrderedMap and OrderedSet.

api.label: isValueObject()
api.synopsis: True if maybeValue is a JavaScript Object which has both equals() and hashCode() methods.

api.label: isSeq()
api.synopsis: True if maybeSeq is a Seq.

api.label: isList()
api.synopsis: True if maybeList is a List.

api.label: isMap()
api.synopsis: True if maybeMap is a Map.

api.label: isOrderedMap()
api.synopsis: True if maybeOrderedMap is an OrderedMap.

api.label: isStack()
api.synopsis: True if maybeStack is a Stack.

api.label: isSet()
api.synopsis: True if maybeSet is a Set.

api.label: isOrderedSet()
api.synopsis: True if maybeOrderedSet is an OrderedSet.

api.label: isRecord()
api.synopsis: True if maybeRecord is a Record.

api.label: has()
api.synopsis: Returns true if the key is defined in the provided collection.

api.label: getIn()
api.synopsis: Returns the value at the provided key path starting at the provided collection, or notSetValue if the key path is not defined.

api.label: hasIn()
api.synopsis: Returns true if the key path is defined in the provided collection.

api.label: removeIn()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the value at the key path removed.

api.label: setIn()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the value at the key path set to the provided value.

api.label: merge()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the remaining collections merged in.

api.label: mergeWith()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the remaining collections merged in, calling the merger function whenever an existing value is encountered.

api.label: mergeDeep()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the remaining collections merged in deeply (recursively).

api.label: mergeDeepWith()
api.synopsis: Returns a copy of the collection with the remaining collections merged in deeply (recursively), calling the merger function whenever an existing value is encountered.
